snippet: China’s cabinet, or State Council, said home sellers would soon pay a 20 percent capital gains tax.
abstract: China’s government says home sellers will soon pay a 20 percent capital gains tax, setting off sharp drop in Chinese stocks; investors worry taxes could take heavy toll on developers; any slowdown in real estate investment could ripple quickly across entire economy.

byline.original: By DAVID BARBOZA and KEITH BRADSHER
byline.contributor: David Barboza reported from Shanghai and Keith Bradsher from Hong Kong.

lead_paragraph: China’s cabinet, or State Council, said home sellers would soon pay a 20 percent capital gains tax.

headline.seo: China Moves to Cool Housing Market, and Stocks Plummet
headline.main: Chinese Stocks Plunge on Plan to Tax Home Sales
headline.print_headline: Chinese Stocks Plunge on Plan to Tax Home Sales
